arm_group.description: Procalcitonin levels will be measured to determine when it is appropriate to discontinue antibiotic therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of the study is to determine the impact of procalcitonin (PCT)-guided therapy on
      duration of antibiotic therapy in critical care unit (CCU) patients with suspected pneumonia
      at Mayo Clinic Health System Eau Claire.

clinical_study.brief_title: Procalcitonin Use in Pneumonia Patients in the Critical Care Setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  18 years old

          -  admitted to critical care unit

          -  placed on pneumonia protocol

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  patients who received outpatient antibiotic therapy within previous 21 days

intervention.intervention_name: Use of procalcitonin as biomarker to guide therapy

facility.name: Mayo Clinic Health System Eau Claire

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Measuring Serum Procalcitonin Levels on Duration of Antimicrobial Therapy in Critical Care Patients With Suspected Pneumonia

primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the entire time they are on antibiotics to treat pneumonia, an expected average of 30 total antibiotic days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in critical care unit

secondary_outcome.description: The average cost of antibiotics per patient, measured in US dollars, based on total antibiotic days.
Participants will be followed their entire length of stay in the hospital, an expected average of 14 days.
secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in the hospital
